first_reading.title: Letter to the Hebrews
first_reading.text:
[[He 8,6]]Brothers and sisters: now our high priest has obtained so much more excellent a ministry as he is mediator of a better covenant, enacted on better promises.
[[He 8,7]]For if that first covenant had been faultless, no place would have been sought for a second one.
[[He 8,8]]But he finds fault with them and says: "Behold, the days are coming, says the Lord, when I will conclude a new covenant with the house of Israel and the house of Judah.
[[He 8,9]]It will not be like the covenant I made with their fathers the day I took them by the hand to lead them forth from the land of Egypt; for they did not stand by my covenant and I ignored them, says the Lord.
[[He 8,10]]But this is the covenant I will establish with the house of Israel after those days, says the Lord: I will put my laws in their minds and I will write them upon their hearts. I will be their God, and they shall be my people.
[[He 8,11]]And they shall not teach, each one his fellow citizen and kinsman, saying, 'Know the Lord,' for all shall know me, from least to greatest.
[[He 8,12]]For I will forgive their evildoing and remember their sins no more."
[[He 8,13]]When he speaks of a "new" covenant, he declares the first one obsolete. And what has become obsolete and has grown old is close to disappearing.

gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Mark
gospel.text:
[[Mc 3,13]]Jesus went up the mountain and summoned those whom he wanted  and they came to him.
[[Mc 3,14]]He appointed twelve (whom he also named apostles) that they might be with him and he might send them forth to preach
[[Mc 3,15]]and to have authority to drive out demons:
[[Mc 3,16]](he appointed the twelve:) Simon, whom he named Peter;
[[Mc 3,17]]James, son of Zebedee, and John the brother of James, whom he named Boanerges, that is, sons of thunder;
[[Mc 3,18]]Andrew, Philip, Bartholomew, Matthew, Thomas, James the son of Alphaeus; Thaddeus, Simon the Cananean,
[[Mc 3,19]]and Judas Iscariot who betrayed him.

psalm.text:
[[Ps 85,8]]Show us, O LORD, your kindness, 
and grant us your salvation.  
[[Ps 85,10]]Near indeed is his salvation to those who fear him, 
glory dwelling in our land.

[[Ps 85,11]]Kindness and truth shall meet; 
justice and peace shall kiss.
[[Ps 85,12]]Truth shall spring out of the earth, 
and justice shall look down from heaven.

[[Ps 85,13]]The LORD himself will give his benefits; 
our land shall yield its increase.
[[Ps 85,14]]Justice shall walk before him, 
and salvation, along the way of his steps.
